posts.subject: Decentralized EH-like Gallery?
posts.body:
Hi there, first post and also long time lurker from clearnet "times". I saw that some people where trying to work in a IFPS-based imageboard downloader-p2psharing app, but it wasn't exactly like EX-EH, so my question is, is there anything in the works to port the EX-EH galleries format into a decentralized "zite" or alike?.

I think is something to look foward in the future, and would be useful outside scan-ecchi world.

Thanks in advance!

>>f5f6e712-522b-413f-b80c-9770c17809e2
Not sure if this was what you wanted, but here is the latest version I downloaded, uploaded to zeroup (22.6.2019). Also had to wrap it into a .zip to be able to upload it, feel free to scan it in virustotal.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1B2zUu8xV1nELhAnoppqqHKwVZSPppwYX2/1569263548-Slave%20Matrix%20Mod%20v2.zip

Updated-link, should be seeded now: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1B2zUu8xV1nELhAnoppqqHKwVZSPppwYX2/1569525851-smmv2.zip

>>25ac81e1-b413-40dd-8af5-044f73584451
You can also assign commands to ZeroNet using the config file "zeronet.conf", here is an example in the docs: 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/faq/#is-it-possible-to-use-a-configuration-file
All the commands you can use are the same as the running parameters for ZeroNet.py. To get a list on non-windows you can use ZeroNet.py --help, or in windows you can use zeronetfolder\lib\zeronet.cmd --help (took me a while to figure that out)

The command you are looking for is "open_browser = False"

You may die in peace, but other would may like to know the answer never the less :)

posts.subject: Uploading files to any ZeroNet though Tor?
posts.body:
Hi there, I'm trying to share things here using ZeroNet zites/services to upload them (ZeroUp/ Interplanetary File System IFS so far) and although it get "published" to other peers and even get listed in the sites, it isn't saved on the network.

I think it may be related to compatibility of websocket  on tor for user safety, so I don't know how to share it here.

Said that, I would ask if any of you managed to upload any file to any ZeroNet Service using tor on Win10, and if so, please comment what one and how you did it, as I'm struggling here to accomplish that.

Last but not least, I tried to convert the file to base64 and then upload the text, but nullpaste wasn't have with the text size.

Thanks in advance

posts.subject: Knowing what size has each board
posts.body:
I think we could benefit from knowing beforehand how big a board is, so we can adjust and select what ones of which we like we can afford to completly seed.

Also knowing the number of peers per board could help us to select where we can help the most, although I guess implementing that could be really tedious.

Thanks in advance.

>>aa484b3d-93fb-4962-a9aa-ba9c560a5f9a
Thanks for the response

>this does not make sense to me. If it is published to peers, it means it is published to network - peers=network ... Why do you think it is not on the network?

Well, I can't navigate to it, the console gives a websocket error and upload percentage shows NaN and doesn't draw the upload meter, pic related.

Also, seeded mb in the my uploads menu never goes up from 0.0MB, my guess is that what ZeroUp publishes to peers successfuly is the new hashed url to the file, so others can see it, but not the file itself at that time, or maybe it is a site bug.

In the future I will try that clone, so thank you again.

>>7dfc9f64-c100-4157-9161-9c33b2565434
Here you have the instructions, my GIMP skills suck a bit, but should suffice, hope it helps.

posts.subject: ZoneArchive flashes and other stuff
posts.body:
Hi there again, since I haven't seen a full place to share or ask about flash games (Maybe htg, but seems a bit dead) I though it would be nice to inject some life to this section creating a new thread about Zone Flashes. It seems he/she is still working on new things, yet the leaks of these new creations have ceased somehow (or I'm just that clumsy to find them).

So, do you know where to get them? I will post one of my favorites flashes from the author, pic-related of course.

Anything flash related is welcome, with special interest in new things from Zone of course.

Seems like .zip isn't allowed here, so here is the link to the IFS zipped flash:
 http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:15f1_1FNq95aMKwz3ioC7u7GQ2jMi7cf5pmsYua_item_3+type:archive
Sorry for this annoying response, but is this thread visible? I guess ZeroNet needs a way to verify things...
Are people still here? Any other sources while we wait for 8kun? I saw the videogames sharing thread, but can't understand most links showed there sadly.

Also, to start sharing, here's a torrent which includes this flash and anothers:

magnet:?xt=urn:btih:04da5d5a925dfc723debdb30c168ba9ab1bfb098&dn=Zone

Have fun!

posts.subject: A cheatsheet about post syntax
posts.body:
Hi there admin, and thanks for starting this place.

I would love to know if there is a cheatsheet that help us newbies to format our posts.

I'm really tired of giving links in white text and not being able to properly format my posts, and can't find anything about it (although I could have perfectly missed it)

Thanks in advance.
